author: jgm
content: There's going to be a balance between supporting all of the various HTTP status codes and keeping it simple.  In this case, and more generally when data is not present for any reason, I'd go with a 404 and potentially additional information in the text.  It seems reasonable to add this to the API spec.

author: .paulharris
content: re. query parameters that specify being allowed an 'array', it looks like the api i'm using thinks of an array of query parameters as `index=1&index=2&index=3`, which to me seems odd, but is that all that ppl are supporting? or are we going to try to support `&index=1,2,3`?

author: mpetrunic
content: index=1,index=2 should work out of box in most server implementions while index=1,2,3 requires application level parsing

author: .paulharris
content: yep, so is the intent we do the application level parsing? without it we'd be pretty limited on URL size, it'd severely limit the number of validators you could query...
